'''Work with “one canvas workflow” in steps:'''

''1.'' Download <nowiki>[[http://bazaar.launchpad.net/%7Ebreathe-dev/breathe-icon-set/trunk/download/head:/breathe_icon_templat-20080905042226-bvdzo9fb8th94dyh-3/Breathe_Icon_Template.svg?file_id=template-20080905042226-bvdzo9fb8th94dyh-2|SVG]]</nowiki> template.<<BR>><<BR>>
''2.'' Put downloaded template into ~/.inkscape/templates (or ~/.config/Inkscape if you are using Inkscape from current SVN). It should then be visible in content of inkscape menu "File → New".<<BR>><<BR>>
     ''For simplicity this step may be skipped and you may start work right after opening downloaded template in inkscape.''<<BR>><<BR>>
''3.'' Enable layers toolbox (keycombo Shift+Ctrl+L or use menu "Layer → Layers..."). After then in toolbox you see 3 layer names with their sublayers:<<BR>>
     ''I.'' instructions<<BR>><<BR>>
     ''II.'' path/template<<BR>><<BR>>
          ''*'' plate<<BR>><<BR>>
     ''III.'' palette<<BR>><<BR>>
          ''*'' Color cues<<BR>><<BR>>
          …<<BR>><<BR>>

''4.'' Rename layer "path/template" to match path and icon name on what you want work (at example "actions/gnome-help")<<BR>><<BR>>
''5.'' Unlock renamed layer with one click on small chain before layer name.<<BR>><<BR>>
''6.'' Draw your icon in layer “path/template” (currently renamed to match your icon).<<BR>><<BR>>
''7.'' Insert into sublayer named “plate” two text objects. In first text object labeled “context” (label may be set by selecting text object, right click → Object Properties, set Label to context) will be text with icon category name (at example “actions”). In second text object labeled “icon-name” will be text with icon name (at example gnome-help)<<BR>><<BR>>
''8.'' Set sublayer “plate” from layer “path/template” (currently renamed to match your icon) to invisible by one click on eye before chain.<<BR>><<BR>>
''9.'' Save icon into SVG file with name of your icon (at example “gnome-help”)<<BR>><<BR>>
